page.title: 16TRANSPORT
page.content: The paucity of public{transport}is a persistent complaint from residents, and combined with the lack of local shops is a serious problem for non - drivers. Of the 32 housholds in the sample only one is without a car. 15 have 2 cars and 2 have 3 cars. This averages at 1.6 cars per houshold. Kingscote has a bus service from Wotton-under-Edge to Stroud and return, running 4 times daily on weekdays, and a minibus service of a round trip from Nailsworth twice daily for 4 weekdays. Only one resident mentioned using buses for shopping. Journey to work is exclusively by car, 9 people commute between 4 and 10 miles, 12 travel from 10 to 16 miles and 7 travel 20 or more miles. Shopping trips are almost entirely by car, to Nailsworth, Cirencester and Tetbury in order of significance.
